snippet: The federal government recorded a budget surplus in January of $55.2 billion, helped by a timing quirk that shifted benefit payments to December.
abstract: Federal government reports deficit of $160.4 billion for first four months of budget year, down from deficit of $194.2 billion in year-earlier period; charts January surplus of $55.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: The federal government recorded a budget surplus in January of $55.2 billion, helped by a timing quirk that shifted benefit payments to December.

headline.main: U.S. Showed Budget Surplus in January
headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Showed Budget Surplus in January
